00005 r"""Code to validate and convert settings of the Microsoft build tools.
00006 
00007 This file contains code to validate and convert settings of the Microsoft
00008 build tools.  The function ConvertToMSBuildSettings(), ValidateMSVSSettings(),
00009 and ValidateMSBuildSettings() are the entry points.
00010 
00011 This file was created by comparing the projects created by Visual Studio 2008
00012 and Visual Studio 2010 for all available settings through the user interface.
00013 The MSBuild schemas were also considered.  They are typically found in the
00014 MSBuild install directory, e.g. c:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild
00015 """
00016 
00017 import sys
00018 import re
00019 
00020 # Dictionaries of settings validators. The key is the tool name, the value is
00021 # a dictionary mapping setting names to validation functions.
00022 _msvs_validators = {}
00023 _msbuild_validators = {}
00024 
00025 
00026 # A dictionary of settings converters. The key is the tool name, the value is
00027 # a dictionary mapping setting names to conversion functions.
00028 _msvs_to_msbuild_converters = {}
00029 
00030 
00031 # Tool name mapping from MSVS to MSBuild.
00032 _msbuild_name_of_tool = {}
00033 
00034 
00035 class _Tool(object):
00036   """Represents a tool used by MSVS or MSBuild.
00037 
00038   Attributes:
00039       msvs_name: The name of the tool in MSVS.
00040       msbuild_name: The name of the tool in MSBuild.
00041   """
00042 
00043   def __init__(self, msvs_name, msbuild_name):
00044     self.msvs_name = msvs_name
00045     self.msbuild_name = msbuild_name
00046 
00047 
00048 def _AddTool(tool):
00049   """Adds a tool to the four dictionaries used to process settings.
00050 
00051   This only defines the tool.  Each setting also needs to be added.
00052 
00053   Args:
00054     tool: The _Tool object to be added.
00055   """
00056   _msvs_validators[tool.msvs_name] = {}
00057   _msbuild_validators[tool.msbuild_name] = {}
00058   _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[tool.msvs_name] = {}
00059   _msbuild_name_of_tool[tool.msvs_name] = tool.msbuild_name
00060 
00061 
00062 def _GetMSBuildToolSettings(msbuild_settings, tool):
00063   """Returns an MSBuild tool dictionary.  Creates it if needed."""
00064   return msbuild_settings.setdefault(tool.msbuild_name, {})

00067 class _Type(object):
00068   """Type of settings (Base class)."""
00069 
00070   def ValidateMSVS(self, value):
00071     """Verifies that the value is legal for MSVS.
00072 
00073     Args:
00074       value: the value to check for this type.
00075 
00076     Raises:
00077       ValueError if value is not valid for MSVS.
00078     """
00079 
00080   def ValidateMSBuild(self, value):
00081     """Verifies that the value is legal for MSBuild.
00082 
00083     Args:
00084       value: the value to check for this type.
00085 
00086     Raises:
00087       ValueError if value is not valid for MSBuild.
00088     """
00089 
00090   def ConvertToMSBuild(self, value):
00091     """Returns the MSBuild equivalent of the MSVS value given.
00092 
00093     Args:
00094       value: the MSVS value to convert.
00095 
00096     Returns:
00097       the MSBuild equivalent.
00098 
00099     Raises:
00100       ValueError if value is not valid.
00101     """
00102     return value
00103 
00104 
00105 class _String(_Type):
00106   """A setting that's just a string."""
00107 
00108   def ValidateMSVS(self, value):
00109     if not isinstance(value, basestring):
00110       raise ValueError('expected string; got %r' % value)
00111 
00112   def ValidateMSBuild(self, value):
00113     if not isinstance(value, basestring):
00114       raise ValueError('expected string; got %r' % value)
00115 
00116   def ConvertToMSBuild(self, value):
00117     # Convert the macros
00118     return ConvertVCMacrosToMSBuild(value)
00119 
00120 
00121 class _StringList(_Type):
00122   """A settings that's a list of strings."""
00123 
00124   def ValidateMSVS(self, value):
00125     if not isinstance(value, basestring) and not isinstance(value, list):
00126       raise ValueError('expected string list; got %r' % value)
00127 
00128   def ValidateMSBuild(self, value):
00129     if not isinstance(value, basestring) and not isinstance(value, list):
00130       raise ValueError('expected string list; got %r' % value)
00131 
00132   def ConvertToMSBuild(self, value):
00133     # Convert the macros
00134     if isinstance(value, list):
00135       return [ConvertVCMacrosToMSBuild(i) for i in value]
00136     else:
00137       return ConvertVCMacrosToMSBuild(value)
00138 
00139 
00140 class _Boolean(_Type):
00141   """Boolean settings, can have the values 'false' or 'true'."""
00142 
00143   def _Validate(self, value):
00144     if value != 'true' and value != 'false':
00145       raise ValueError('expected bool; got %r' % value)
00146 
00147   def ValidateMSVS(self, value):
00148     self._Validate(value)
00149 
00150   def ValidateMSBuild(self, value):
00151     self._Validate(value)
00152 
00153   def ConvertToMSBuild(self, value):
00154     self._Validate(value)
00155     return value
00156 
00157 
00158 class _Integer(_Type):
00159   """Integer settings."""
00160 
00161   def __init__(self, msbuild_base=10):
00162     _Type.__init__(self)
00163     self._msbuild_base = msbuild_base
00164 
00165   def ValidateMSVS(self, value):
00166     # Try to convert, this will raise ValueError if invalid.
00167     self.ConvertToMSBuild(value)
00168 
00169   def ValidateMSBuild(self, value):
00170     # Try to convert, this will raise ValueError if invalid.
00171     int(value, self._msbuild_base)
00172 
00173   def ConvertToMSBuild(self, value):
00174     msbuild_format = (self._msbuild_base == 10) and '%d' or '0x%04x'
00175     return msbuild_format % int(value)
00176 
00177 
00178 class _Enumeration(_Type):
00179   """Type of settings that is an enumeration.
00180 
00181   In MSVS, the values are indexes like '0', '1', and '2'.
00182   MSBuild uses text labels that are more representative, like 'Win32'.
00183 
00184   Constructor args:
00185     label_list: an array of MSBuild labels that correspond to the MSVS index.
00186         In the rare cases where MSVS has skipped an index value, None is
00187         used in the array to indicate the unused spot.
00188     new: an array of labels that are new to MSBuild.
00189   """
00190 
00191   def __init__(self, label_list, new=None):
00192     _Type.__init__(self)
00193     self._label_list = label_list
00194     self._msbuild_values = set(value for value in label_list
00195                                if value is not None)
00196     if new is not None:
00197       self._msbuild_values.update(new)
00198 
00199   def ValidateMSVS(self, value):
00200     # Try to convert.  It will raise an exception if not valid.
00201     self.ConvertToMSBuild(value)
00202 
00203   def ValidateMSBuild(self, value):
00204     if value not in self._msbuild_values:
00205       raise ValueError('unrecognized enumerated value %s' % value)
00206 
00207   def ConvertToMSBuild(self, value):
00208     index = int(value)
00209     if index < 0 or index >= len(self._label_list):
00210       raise ValueError('index value (%d) not in expected range [0, %d)' %
00211                        (index, len(self._label_list)))
00212     label = self._label_list[index]
00213     if label is None:
00214       raise ValueError('converted value for %s not specified.' % value)
00215     return label
00216 
00217 
00218 # Instantiate the various generic types.
00219 _boolean = _Boolean()
00220 _integer = _Integer()
00221 # For now, we don't do any special validation on these types:
00222 _string = _String()
00223 _file_name = _String()
00224 _folder_name = _String()
00225 _file_list = _StringList()
00226 _folder_list = _StringList()
00227 _string_list = _StringList()
00228 # Some boolean settings went from numerical values to boolean.  The
00229 # mapping is 0: default, 1: false, 2: true.
00230 _newly_boolean = _Enumeration(['', 'false', 'true'])

00233 def _Same(tool, name, setting_type):
00234   """Defines a setting that has the same name in MSVS and MSBuild.
00235 
00236   Args:
00237     tool: a dictionary that gives the names of the tool for MSVS and MSBuild.
00238     name: the name of the setting.
00239     setting_type: the type of this setting.
00240   """
00241   _Renamed(tool, name, name, setting_type)
00242 
00243 
00244 def _Renamed(tool, msvs_name, msbuild_name, setting_type):
00245   """Defines a setting for which the name has changed.
00246 
00247   Args:
00248     tool: a dictionary that gives the names of the tool for MSVS and MSBuild.
00249     msvs_name: the name of the MSVS setting.
00250     msbuild_name: the name of the MSBuild setting.
00251     setting_type: the type of this setting.
00252   """
00253 
00254   def _Translate(value, msbuild_settings):
00255     msbuild_tool_settings = _GetMSBuildToolSettings(msbuild_settings, tool)
00256     msbuild_tool_settings[msbuild_name] = setting_type.ConvertToMSBuild(value)
00257 
00258   _msvs_validators[tool.msvs_name][msvs_name] = setting_type.ValidateMSVS
00259   _msbuild_validators[tool.msbuild_name][msbuild_name] = (
00260       setting_type.ValidateMSBuild)
00261   _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[tool.msvs_name][msvs_name] = _Translate
00262 
00263 
00264 def _Moved(tool, settings_name, msbuild_tool_name, setting_type):
00265   _MovedAndRenamed(tool, settings_name, msbuild_tool_name, settings_name,
00266                    setting_type)
00267 
00268 
00269 def _MovedAndRenamed(tool, msvs_settings_name, msbuild_tool_name,
00270                      msbuild_settings_name, setting_type):
00271   """Defines a setting that may have moved to a new section.
00272 
00273   Args:
00274     tool: a dictionary that gives the names of the tool for MSVS and MSBuild.
00275     msvs_settings_name: the MSVS name of the setting.
00276     msbuild_tool_name: the name of the MSBuild tool to place the setting under.
00277     msbuild_settings_name: the MSBuild name of the setting.
00278     setting_type: the type of this setting.
00279   """
00280 
00281   def _Translate(value, msbuild_settings):
00282     tool_settings = msbuild_settings.setdefault(msbuild_tool_name, {})
00283     tool_settings[msbuild_settings_name] = setting_type.ConvertToMSBuild(value)
00284 
00285   _msvs_validators[tool.msvs_name][msvs_settings_name] = (
00286       setting_type.ValidateMSVS)
00287   validator = setting_type.ValidateMSBuild
00288   _msbuild_validators[msbuild_tool_name][msbuild_settings_name] = validator
00289   _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[tool.msvs_name][msvs_settings_name] = _Translate

00292 def _MSVSOnly(tool, name, setting_type):
00293   """Defines a setting that is only found in MSVS.
00294 
00295   Args:
00296     tool: a dictionary that gives the names of the tool for MSVS and MSBuild.
00297     name: the name of the setting.
00298     setting_type: the type of this setting.
00299   """
00300 
00301   def _Translate(unused_value, unused_msbuild_settings):
00302     # Since this is for MSVS only settings, no translation will happen.
00303     pass
00304 
00305   _msvs_validators[tool.msvs_name][name] = setting_type.ValidateMSVS
00306   _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[tool.msvs_name][name] = _Translate
00307 
00308 
00309 def _MSBuildOnly(tool, name, setting_type):
00310   """Defines a setting that is only found in MSBuild.
00311 
00312   Args:
00313     tool: a dictionary that gives the names of the tool for MSVS and MSBuild.
00314     name: the name of the setting.
00315     setting_type: the type of this setting.
00316   """
00317 
00318   def _Translate(value, msbuild_settings):
00319     # Let msbuild-only properties get translated as-is from msvs_settings.
00320     tool_settings = msbuild_settings.setdefault(tool.msbuild_name, {})
00321     tool_settings[name] = value
00322 
00323   _msbuild_validators[tool.msbuild_name][name] = setting_type.ValidateMSBuild
00324   _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[tool.msvs_name][name] = _Translate
00325 
00326 
00327 def _ConvertedToAdditionalOption(tool, msvs_name, flag):
00328   """Defines a setting that's handled via a command line option in MSBuild.
00329 
00330   Args:
00331     tool: a dictionary that gives the names of the tool for MSVS and MSBuild.
00332     msvs_name: the name of the MSVS setting that if 'true' becomes a flag
00333     flag: the flag to insert at the end of the AdditionalOptions
00334   """
00335 
00336   def _Translate(value, msbuild_settings):
00337     if value == 'true':
00338       tool_settings = _GetMSBuildToolSettings(msbuild_settings, tool)
00339       if 'AdditionalOptions' in tool_settings:
00340         new_flags = '%s %s' % (tool_settings['AdditionalOptions'], flag)
00341       else:
00342         new_flags = flag
00343       tool_settings['AdditionalOptions'] = new_flags
00344   _msvs_validators[tool.msvs_name][msvs_name] = _boolean.ValidateMSVS
00345   _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[tool.msvs_name][msvs_name] = _Translate
00346 
00347 
00348 def _CustomGeneratePreprocessedFile(tool, msvs_name):
00349   def _Translate(value, msbuild_settings):
00350     tool_settings = _GetMSBuildToolSettings(msbuild_settings, tool)
00351     if value == '0':
00352       tool_settings['PreprocessToFile'] = 'false'
00353       tool_settings['PreprocessSuppressLineNumbers'] = 'false'
00354     elif value == '1':  # /P
00355       tool_settings['PreprocessToFile'] = 'true'
00356       tool_settings['PreprocessSuppressLineNumbers'] = 'false'
00357     elif value == '2':  # /EP /P
00358       tool_settings['PreprocessToFile'] = 'true'
00359       tool_settings['PreprocessSuppressLineNumbers'] = 'true'
00360     else:
00361       raise ValueError('value must be one of [0, 1, 2]; got %s' % value)
00362   # Create a bogus validator that looks for '0', '1', or '2'
00363   msvs_validator = _Enumeration(['a', 'b', 'c']).ValidateMSVS
00364   _msvs_validators[tool.msvs_name][msvs_name] = msvs_validator
00365   msbuild_validator = _boolean.ValidateMSBuild
00366   msbuild_tool_validators = _msbuild_validators[tool.msbuild_name]
00367   msbuild_tool_validators['PreprocessToFile'] = msbuild_validator
00368   msbuild_tool_validators['PreprocessSuppressLineNumbers'] = msbuild_validator
00369   _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[tool.msvs_name][msvs_name] = _Translate
00370 
00371 
00372 fix_vc_macro_slashes_regex_list = ('IntDir', 'OutDir')
00373 fix_vc_macro_slashes_regex = re.compile(
00374   r'(\$\((?:%s)\))(?:[\\/]+)' % "|".join(fix_vc_macro_slashes_regex_list)
00375 )
00376 
00377 # Regular expression to detect keys that were generated by exclusion lists
00378 _EXCLUDED_SUFFIX_RE = re.compile('^(.*)_excluded$')
00379 
00380 
00381 def _ValidateExclusionSetting(setting, settings, error_msg, stderr=sys.stderr):
00382   """Verify that 'setting' is valid if it is generated from an exclusion list.
00383 
00384   If the setting appears to be generated from an exclusion list, the root name
00385   is checked.
00386 
00387   Args:
00388       setting:   A string that is the setting name to validate
00389       settings:  A dictionary where the keys are valid settings
00390       error_msg: The message to emit in the event of error
00391       stderr:    The stream receiving the error messages.
00392   """
00393   # This may be unrecognized because it's an exclusion list. If the
00394   # setting name has the _excluded suffix, then check the root name.
00395   unrecognized = True
00396   m = re.match(_EXCLUDED_SUFFIX_RE, setting)
00397   if m:
00398     root_setting = m.group(1)
00399     unrecognized = root_setting not in settings
00400 
00401   if unrecognized:
00402     # We don't know this setting. Give a warning.
00403     print >> stderr, error_msg
00404 
00405 
00406 def FixVCMacroSlashes(s):
00407   """Replace macros which have excessive following slashes.
00408 
00409   These macros are known to have a built-in trailing slash. Furthermore, many
00410   scripts hiccup on processing paths with extra slashes in the middle.
00411 
00412   This list is probably not exhaustive.  Add as needed.
00413   """
00414   if '$' in s:
00415     s = fix_vc_macro_slashes_regex.sub(r'\1', s)
00416   return s
00417 
00418 
00419 def ConvertVCMacrosToMSBuild(s):
00420   """Convert the the MSVS macros found in the string to the MSBuild equivalent.
00421 
00422   This list is probably not exhaustive.  Add as needed.
00423   """
00424   if '$' in s:
00425     replace_map = {
00426         '$(ConfigurationName)': '$(Configuration)',
00427         '$(InputDir)': '%(RelativeDir)',
00428         '$(InputExt)': '%(Extension)',
00429         '$(InputFileName)': '%(Filename)%(Extension)',
00430         '$(InputName)': '%(Filename)',
00431         '$(InputPath)': '%(Identity)',
00432         '$(ParentName)': '$(ProjectFileName)',
00433         '$(PlatformName)': '$(Platform)',
00434         '$(SafeInputName)': '%(Filename)',
00435     }
00436     for old, new in replace_map.iteritems():
00437       s = s.replace(old, new)
00438     s = FixVCMacroSlashes(s)
00439   return s
00440 
00441 
00442 def ConvertToMSBuildSettings(msvs_settings, stderr=sys.stderr):
00443   """Converts MSVS settings (VS2008 and earlier) to MSBuild settings (VS2010+).
00444 
00445   Args:
00446       msvs_settings: A dictionary.  The key is the tool name.  The values are
00447           themselves dictionaries of settings and their values.
00448       stderr: The stream receiving the error messages.
00449 
00450   Returns:
00451       A dictionary of MSBuild settings.  The key is either the MSBuild tool name
00452       or the empty string (for the global settings).  The values are themselves
00453       dictionaries of settings and their values.
00454   """
00455   msbuild_settings = {}
00456   for msvs_tool_name, msvs_tool_settings in msvs_settings.iteritems():
00457     if msvs_tool_name in _msvs_to_msbuild_converters:
00458       msvs_tool = _msvs_to_msbuild_converters[msvs_tool_name]
00459       for msvs_setting, msvs_value in msvs_tool_settings.iteritems():
00460         if msvs_setting in msvs_tool:
00461           # Invoke the translation function.
00462           try:
00463             msvs_tool[msvs_setting](msvs_value, msbuild_settings)
00464           except ValueError, e:
00465             print >> stderr, ('Warning: while converting %s/%s to MSBuild, '
00466                               '%s' % (msvs_tool_name, msvs_setting, e))
00467         else:
00468           _ValidateExclusionSetting(msvs_setting,
00469                                     msvs_tool,
00470                                     ('Warning: unrecognized setting %s/%s '
00471                                      'while converting to MSBuild.' %
00472                                      (msvs_tool_name, msvs_setting)),
00473                                     stderr)
00474     else:
00475       print >> stderr, ('Warning: unrecognized tool %s while converting to '
00476                         'MSBuild.' % msvs_tool_name)
00477   return msbuild_settings
00478

00480 def ValidateMSVSSettings(settings, stderr=sys.stderr):
00481   """Validates that the names of the settings are valid for MSVS.
00482 
00483   Args:
00484       settings: A dictionary.  The key is the tool name.  The values are
00485           themselves dictionaries of settings and their values.
00486       stderr: The stream receiving the error messages.
00487   """
00488   _ValidateSettings(_msvs_validators, settings, stderr)
00489 
00490 
00491 def ValidateMSBuildSettings(settings, stderr=sys.stderr):
00492   """Validates that the names of the settings are valid for MSBuild.
00493 
00494   Args:
00495       settings: A dictionary.  The key is the tool name.  The values are
00496           themselves dictionaries of settings and their values.
00497       stderr: The stream receiving the error messages.
00498   """
00499   _ValidateSettings(_msbuild_validators, settings, stderr)
00500 
00501 
00502 def _ValidateSettings(validators, settings, stderr):
00503   """Validates that the settings are valid for MSBuild or MSVS.
00504 
00505   We currently only validate the names of the settings, not their values.
00506 
00507   Args:
00508       validators: A dictionary of tools and their validators.
00509       settings: A dictionary.  The key is the tool name.  The values are
00510           themselves dictionaries of settings and their values.
00511       stderr: The stream receiving the error messages.
00512   """
00513   for tool_name in settings:
00514     if tool_name in validators:
00515       tool_validators = validators[tool_name]
00516       for setting, value in settings[tool_name].iteritems():
00517         if setting in tool_validators:
00518           try:
00519             tool_validators[setting](value)
00520           except ValueError, e:
00521             print >> stderr, ('Warning: for %s/%s, %s' %
00522                               (tool_name, setting, e))
00523         else:
00524           _ValidateExclusionSetting(setting,
00525                                     tool_validators,
00526                                     ('Warning: unrecognized setting %s/%s' %
00527                                      (tool_name, setting)),
00528                                     stderr)
00529 
00530     else:
00531       print >> stderr, ('Warning: unrecognized tool %s' % tool_name)
00532

00534 # MSVS and MBuild names of the tools.
00535 _compile = _Tool('VCCLCompilerTool', 'ClCompile')
00536 _link = _Tool('VCLinkerTool', 'Link')
00537 _midl = _Tool('VCMIDLTool', 'Midl')
00538 _rc = _Tool('VCResourceCompilerTool', 'ResourceCompile')
00539 _lib = _Tool('VCLibrarianTool', 'Lib')
00540 _manifest = _Tool('VCManifestTool', 'Manifest')
00541 _masm = _Tool('MASM', 'MASM')
00542

00544 _AddTool(_compile)
00545 _AddTool(_link)
00546 _AddTool(_midl)
00547 _AddTool(_rc)
00548 _AddTool(_lib)
00549 _AddTool(_manifest)
00550 _AddTool(_masm)
00551 # Add sections only found in the MSBuild settings.
00552 _msbuild_validators[''] = {}
00553 _msbuild_validators['ProjectReference'] = {}
00554 _msbuild_validators['ManifestResourceCompile'] = {}
00555 
00556 # Descriptions of the compiler options, i.e. VCCLCompilerTool in MSVS and
00557 # ClCompile in MSBuild.
00558 # See "c:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\1033\cl.xml" for
00559 # the schema of the MSBuild ClCompile settings.
00560 
00561 # Options that have the same name in MSVS and MSBuild
00562 _Same(_compile, 'AdditionalIncludeDirectories', _folder_list)  # /I
00563 _Same(_compile, 'AdditionalOptions', _string_list)
00564 _Same(_compile, 'AdditionalUsingDirectories', _folder_list)  # /AI
00565 _Same(_compile, 'AssemblerListingLocation', _file_name)  # /Fa
00566 _Same(_compile, 'BrowseInformationFile', _file_name)
00567 _Same(_compile, 'BufferSecurityCheck', _boolean)  # /GS
00568 _Same(_compile, 'DisableLanguageExtensions', _boolean)  # /Za
00569 _Same(_compile, 'DisableSpecificWarnings', _string_list)  # /wd
00570 _Same(_compile, 'EnableFiberSafeOptimizations', _boolean)  # /GT
00571 _Same(_compile, 'EnablePREfast', _boolean)  # /analyze Visible='false'
00572 _Same(_compile, 'ExpandAttributedSource', _boolean)  # /Fx
00573 _Same(_compile, 'FloatingPointExceptions', _boolean)  # /fp:except
00574 _Same(_compile, 'ForceConformanceInForLoopScope', _boolean)  # /Zc:forScope
00575 _Same(_compile, 'ForcedIncludeFiles', _file_list)  # /FI
00576 _Same(_compile, 'ForcedUsingFiles', _file_list)  # /FU
00577 _Same(_compile, 'GenerateXMLDocumentationFiles', _boolean)  # /doc
00578 _Same(_compile, 'IgnoreStandardIncludePath', _boolean)  # /X
00579 _Same(_compile, 'MinimalRebuild', _boolean)  # /Gm
00580 _Same(_compile, 'OmitDefaultLibName', _boolean)  # /Zl
